titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an George Edward Moore, 5. 2. [1947]
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Original bei Timothy Moore; Kopie im BA. Publiziert (deutsch: Briefe, S. 225; Cambridge Letters, S. 327).

list.item: 2007/06: Conversion from Folio Flat File to XML

div.p: I'm having a cold now, or rather, a sore throat. It isn't bad at all but I very much want to get rid of it by the end of the week & I think I'd better stay at home. So I shan't see you tomorrow. If I don't hear from you, & nothing unexpected happens, I'll come Thursday next week.
I hope you're well again & keeping that way in spite of this bl. â€’ weather.
